deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text: @dev abstract class for charity and crowdfunding contracts to inherit from
@dev array of IDs of campaings that correspond to their campaign IDs as well
@dev mapping of campaign structs to their Ids
@dev integer counter that will be incremented once we add new campaings and used to assign them IDs

@notice Displays some campaign data after it is being added to make sure it was stored correctly
 @dev emitted when we call AddCampaign to emit the id, name, and the address of the one who added the campaign

@notice Displays some info about a donation once it happended
 @dev emitted when we call Donate() to emit the address of donater, amount donated, and the Raised amount until now
@dev vlidate that the campaign is in an Ongoing state to accept donations

@dev function that adds a new campaign to the mapping after taking the required parameters from the Raiser, uses owner() to eb the Raiser
 Note The commented lines can be used to extend code functionality
@dev checks that the raised amount isnt equal to the goal (closes campaign if it is), checks that the sent amount is equal to the donated amount, increases the raised amount for the campaign.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "You don't have the right to claim the funds"

documentation.text:
@notice allows us to get the raised funds to our account
 @dev checks that the claimer is the raiser, checks that the campaign is closed, then sends the raised funds.
@dev getter function for raised amount variable

@notice Explain to an end user what this does
 @dev some getter functions i used in some testing

documentation.text:
@notice allows us to get the raised funds to our account
 @dev checks that the claimer is the raiser, checks that the campaign is closed, then sends the raised funds.
@dev getter function for raised amount variable

@notice Explain to an end user what this does
 @dev some getter functions i used in some testing

devdoc.details: has 3 main functions named AddCampaign, Donate, and claimFunds

logAddedCampaign(uint256,string,address).details: emitted when we call AddCampaign to emit the id, name, and the address of the one who added the campaign

logDonated(address,uint256,uint256).details: emitted when we call Donate() to emit the address of donater, amount donated, and the Raised amount until now

AddCampaign(string,string,uint256,uint25.details: function that adds a new campaign to the mapping after taking the required parameters from the Raiser, uses owner() to eb the Raiser Note The commented lines can be used to extend code functionality

Donate(uint256).details: checks that the raised amount isnt equal to the goal (closes campaign if it is), checks that the sent amount is equal to the donated amount, increases the raised amount for the campaign.

claimFunds(uint256).details: checks that the claimer is the raiser, checks that the campaign is closed, then sends the raised funds.

getRaisedAmt(uint256).details: getter function for raised amount variable

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

retcount().details: some getter functions i used in some testing

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

Campaigns.details: mapping of campaign structs to their Ids

IDList.details: array of IDs of campaings that correspond to their campaign IDs as well

campaignCount.details: integer counter that will be incremented once we add new campaings and used to assign them IDs

devdoc.title: The charity contract

logAddedCampaign(uint256,string,address).notice: Displays some campaign data after it is being added to make sure it was stored correctly

logDonated(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Displays some info about a donation once it happended

claimFunds(uint256).notice: allows us to get the raised funds to our account

retcount().notice: Explain to an end user what this does

userdoc.notice: Allows us to add campaigns, donate, and collect the raised funds
